Dear Kimberly Noelle Bair:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/21/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (c) A physical examination for each child as
follows, unless a greater frequency is
medically indicated:
• (ii) A physical examination every 14
months.
One of three open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed contained
documentation that a physical examination was not completed timely.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Be more specific when documenting the SOGIE preferred by family and
include in recommendation.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The one special evaluation, 2025SEC0000220, documenting a finding of
corporal punishment was reviewed. The recommendation of a regular license
upon completion of an approved CAP was appropriate based on the family's
history and the recommendation of the other MDHHS worker involved.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The one CAP submitted by the agency during this review period was approved on
4/19/2024 and was written in response to the 2024 licensing renewal inspection
report dated 3/26/2024. Of the four violations addressed through that CAP, three
were DHHS policy violations no longer regulated by DCWL. The remaining
violation was for licensing rule 400.12212(3)(a) related to timely employee
performance evaluation. The CAP was successful in achieving and maintaining
compliance with performance evaluation requirements evidenced by the violation
not be repeated during this year's inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator report was completed on 3/14/25 and identified areas in
which the agency had barriers to maintaining compliance due an Interstate
Compact case in which the other state's worker had poor communication.
Additionally, placement challenges and the local court increasing their assignment
of juvenile justice cases added responsibilities to the case managers. Despite the
challenges, the chief administrator report indicated the agency was able to
maintain compliance well due to the effective implementation and oversight of the
prior year's CAP.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported receiving supportive supervision
throughout the year during which there was a reduction in staffing due to allocation
changes. They reported utilizing tracking methods implemented after previous
inspection CAPs which have been helpful with maintaining compliance. No
concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The office appeared to have adequate space and equipment to provide for the
delivery of foster home certification, foster care, and independent living services.
Files are stored in a secured file area. The closed adoption files are stored in a
locked cabinet within a locked room.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
